IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THROUGH A PROGRESSIVE LIBERAL ARTS CURRICULUM AND AN ENRICHING CO-CURRICULAR PROGRAM, THE SCHOOL EDUCATES THE WHOLE STUDENT: MIND, BODY AND, ABOVE ALL CHARACTER.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE SCHOOL'S MISSION IS TO PREPARE STUDENTS TO SUCCEED IN COLLEGE AND LIFE AS OUTSTANDING LEADERS, INCISIVE THINKERS, AND EXEMPLARY CITIZENS.
IRS990.Desc: THE SCHOOL PROVIDES ACADEMIC AND OTHER RELATED ACTIVITIES TO STUDENTS IN VARIOUS CLASSES FROM NURSERY THROUGH GRADE TWELVE. THE SCHOOL OPERATES AT TWO LOCATIONS IN BROOKLYN, NEW YORK. THE LOWER SCHOOL IS LOCATED IN PARK SLOPE AND SERVES APPROXIMATELY 255 CHILDREN FROM NURSERY THROUGH GRADE 4. THE MIDDLE AND UPPER SCHOOL, SITUATED ON A 25 ACRE CAMPUS IN DYKER HEIGHTS, SERVICES APPROXIMATELY 890 CHILDREN IN GRADES 5 THROUGH 12.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: USES OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES, CONSISTING OF THE BOARD DESIGNATED AND DONOR RESTRICTED FUNDS. THE PURPOSES OF ALL OF THESE FUNDS INCLUDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FACULTY SUPPORT, AS WELL AS FACILITY MAINTENANCE.

THE SCHOOL IS A QUALIFIED ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND FROM STATE AND LOCAL INCOME TAXES UNDER COMPARABLE LAWS. THE SCHOOL HAS EVALUATED ITS CURRENT TAX POSITIONS AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2022. THE SCHOOL DOES NOT HAVE ANY SIGNIFICANT UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS FOR WHICH A RESERVE WOULD BE NECESSARY.
FINANCIAL AID AND TUITION REMISSION -10,552,984. LOSS ON UNCOLLECTABLE PLEDGES -277,783. RENT EXPENSE 5,645.

THE SCHOOL'S POLICY IS ADEQUATELY DESCRIBED IN VARIOUS PUBLICATIONS DISTRIBUTED BY THE SCHOOL AND AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC. THERE IS ALSO A LINK OF THE NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE HOMEPAGE.
THE SCHOOL RECEIVED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FROM THE NEW YORK STATE EDUCATION DEPARTMENT.

FAMILIES SEEKING FINANCIAL AID, IN ORDER TO DEFRAY THE COSTS OF TUITION, PROVIDED CERTAIN PERSONAL FINANCIAL DATA TO AN INDEPENDENT REVIEW ORGANIZATION. BASED ON THESE RESULTS, THE SCHOOL'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO APPLICANTS WHO QUALIFY UNDER THE GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY THE TRUSTEES OF THE SCHOOL IN THE FORM OF NONCASH REDUCTIONS IN THE APPLICANTS' ANNUAL TUITION.
THE SCHOOL PROVIDES HOUSING FOR THE HOS, CHIEF ADVANCEMENT OFFICER AND HEAD OF ATHLETICS. NO GROSS UP PAYMENTS ARE REQUIRED. THESE ARE INCLUDED IN TAXABLE WAGES.

THE SCHOOL PAID SEVERANCE OF $116,550 TO FORMER ASSISTANT HEAD OF SCHOOL. THE SCHOOL MAINTAINS A 457F PLAN FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. IN JUNE 2021, A CONTRIBUTION OF $50,000 WAS MADE TO THE PLAN DURING THE YEAR. A DISTRIBUTION OF $216,191 WAS MADE IN TAX YEAR 2021.

THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AWARDED A NON-FIXED DISCRETIONARY BONUS OF $125,000 TO AUDRIUS BARZDUKAS, HEAD OF SCHOOL. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AWARDED A NON-FIXED DISCRETIONARY BONUS OF $10,000 BONUS TO LYNDA CASARELLA, CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER, A $10,000 BONUS TO REBEKAH SOLLITTO, ASSISTANT HEAD OF SCHOOL, AND A $5,000 BONUS TO CAROLYN QUIGLEY, DIRECTOR OF EXTERNAL LEARNING, DURING THE YEAR. THESE DECISIONS ARE MADE ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: SPOUSE OF CURRENT TRUSTEE OF THE SCHOOL

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THIS NUMBER REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS MADE, AND NOT THE NUMBER OF ITEMS CONTRIBUTED.
THE SCHOOL WILL HIRE A THIRD PARTY TO SELL DONATED BOOKS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S DRAFT 990 IS REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD BEFORE FILING. THE BOARD RECEIVED A PUBLIC DISCLOSURE COPY OF THE RETURN BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL TRUSTEES, OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE ASKED TO COMPLETE A FORMAL CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST FORM/QUESTIONNAIRE. THIS IS DONE AT EACH YEAR'S FIRST BOARD MEETING AND MONITORED TO ASSURE COMPLIANCE. EACH TRUSTEE, OFFICER AND KEY PERSON OF THE SCHOOL SHALL PROMPTLY DISCLOSE ANY DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL OR ANY OTHER INTEREST IN ANY PROPOSED OR EXISTING ARRANGEMENT WITH THE SCHOOL PRIOR TO THE START OF ANY NEGOTIATIONS WITH RESPECT TO SUCH MATTER. A DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL INTEREST OR ANY OTHER INTEREST REQUIRED TO BE DISCLOSED UNDER THIS POLICY SHALL BE DISCLOSED IN WRITING TO THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE BOARD; SUCH DISCLOSURE SHALL INCLUDE ALL MATERIAL FACTS AND SUPPLY ANY REASON WHY THE ARRANGEMENT MIGHT BE OR NOT BE IN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE SCHOOL. THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE BOARD SHALL REFER THE ISSUE TO THE FULL BOARD, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, OR OTHER BOARD COMMITTEE HAVING DECISION-MAKING AUTHORITY OVER THE SUBSTANTIVE MATTER IN QUESTION (THE "COMMITTEE"). FOR EACH INTEREST DISCLOSED, THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE WILL DETERMINE WHETHER TO: A) TAKE ANY ACTION; B) ASSURE FULL DISCLOSURE TO THE BOARD AND OTHER INDIVIDUALS COVERED BY THE POLICY, C) ASK THE PERSON TO RECUSE HIMSELF OR HERSELF FROM PARTICIPATION IN RELATED DISCUSSIONS OR DECISIONS WITHIN THE BOARD, OR D) ASK THE PERSON TO RESIGN FROM HIS OR HER POSITION; OR, IF THE PERSON REFUSES TO RESIGN, BECOME SUBJECT TO POSSIBLE REMOVAL IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BOARD'S REMOVAL PROCEDURES. IF THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE HAS REASONABLE CAUSE TO BELIEVE THAT A TRUSTEE, OFFICER OR KEY PERSON HAS FAILED TO DISCLOSE A DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL OR ANY OTHER INTEREST SUBJECT TO THIS POLICY, IT SHALL INFORM THE TRUSTEE, OFFICER OR KEY PERSON OF THE BASIS FOR SUCH BELIEF AND AFFORD THE TRUSTEE, OFFICER OR KEY PERSON AN OPPORTUNITY TO EXPLAIN THE ALLEGED FAILURE TO DISCLOSE. IF, AFTER HEARING THE RESPONSE OF SUCH INDIVIDUAL AND MAKING SUCH FURTHER INVESTIGATION AS MAY BE WARRANTED BY THE CIRCUMSTANCES, THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE DETERMINES THAT THE TRUSTEE, OFFICER OR KEY PERSON HAS IN FACT FAILED TO DISCLOSE A DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL OR OTHER MATERIAL INTEREST SUBJECT TO THIS POLICY, IT SHALL TAKE APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINARY AND CORRECTIVE ACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPARABLE DATA IS ASCERTAINED THROUGH NEW YORK STATE ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DATABASES AND REPORTED TO THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE AT THE OFFICES OF POLY PREP COUNTY DAY SCHOOL.
